info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 07 at 9:40AM CDT until August 07 at 11:15AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Illinois, including the following areas, Boone, Lee, Ogle and Winnebago. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Flooding of roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 934 AM CDT, doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 2 inches are expected over the area, with possibly over 2 in parts of Lee County with rainfall rates will be heaviest, through the rest of the morning. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Rises on the Pecatonica and Green Rivers and Buffalo Creek, as well as tributaries to these, are expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rockford, Belvidere, Loves Park, Machesney Park, Dixon, Roscoe, Rochelle, South Beloit, Rockton, Poplar Grove, Byron, Oregon, Mount Morris, Amboy, Polo, Rockford Airport, Candlewick Lake, Cherry Valley, Winnebago and Davis Junction. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
